content.user_title: Convert HTML prototypes to React components
content.value_statement: Transform HTML design prototypes into production-ready React components with glassmorphism styling. The 5-step guided workflow automates structure extraction, component mapping, scaffolding, and quality validation.
actual_capabilities: Extract HTML structure and glassmorphism classes automatically
Map HTML elements to shadcn/ui components with guided decisions
Scaffold React component files from templates
Support interactive-card, display-card, and layout-section templates
limitations: Does not create new modules (use module-scaffolder first)
User must complete business logic implementation manually

faq.question: What file formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: Supports HTML prototype files (.html) with glassmorphism classes. Output is TypeScript React components (.tsx).

faq.question: What are the component size limits?
faq.answer: Validated components must not exceed 180 lines. Larger components should be split into smaller sub-components.

faq.question: Can I use this skill with non-glassmorphism designs?
faq.answer: The skill is optimized for glassmorphism styling. For other design systems, code components manually or adapt templates.

faq.question: Is my project data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. All scripts operate only within the project directory. No data is sent externally or stored beyond project files.

faq.question: Validation fails, what should I check?
faq.answer: Common issues: missing I prefix on interfaces, use of any types, invalid glassmorphism classes, excessive relative imports.

faq.question: How does this compare to manual component creation?
faq.answer: This skill provides 70-75% time savings through automation of structure analysis, template generation, and quality validation.
